name: Plushy Heart Knit
suggested_yarn: Yarn Over New York Broadway sparkle sock
full_text: Got a knack for knitting? Whip up a cute little Plushy Heart using your sock weight or DK scraps. Each heart takes less than 20gr of yarn and works up in only a few hours. Make one for everyone you love. Including yourself. Please note, this pattern is worked using 3 double-pointed needles until the split for the tops, then you’ll need 5 needles. For the body of the heart, the front half is on Needle 1, the back half is on Needle 2 and the third needle is for knitting. Heart is worked in rounds from bottom point. Sizing and Gauge: Approximately 4” across by 4” tall. Sock weight: 14 sts/ 21 rounds per 2”/ 5cm DK weight: 11 sts/ 18 rounds per 2”/ 5cm Suggested Materials: 1 locking stitch markers Large-eye needle to weave in ends Stuffing of choice (polyfil, yarn scraps) Sock weight Yarn Over New York sock/ fingering weight yarn or equivalent yarn, approximately 20gr Times Square sock, Broadway sparkle sock, Harlem sock, Wave Hill zebra fingering, Alphabet City tweed US 1 (2.25mm) set of 5 dpns (double pointed needles) DK weight Yarn Over New York DK yarn or equivalent yarn, approximately 20gr (Can substitute sock yarn held double) Greenwich Village DK, Kew Gardens merino/nylon DK, Tribeca sparkle DK US 2.5 (3mm) set of 5 dpns (double pointed needles) Find yarn at yarnovernewyork.com
